attributes.description: Ne'er refuse to eat food their children use, with whom Dasharatha enrolled on high, pure as Gods
Lord of Life, pure Mahendra, Ráma clasps feet as Indra in realms above, imperial Indra girt by Gods of Storm
Preceptor of the Gods whose feet Indra clasps in realms above
Great Father who pities all, king gained blissful home in Brahmá's heavenly home for aye
King of birds with whom other birds cannot vie
Deities by whom imperial Indra is girt, comparison to king's might
Prince, moonbright lord, sinless glorious chief, steadfast, hero of lofty mind, scourge of foes, glory shone like fire, far renowned, faithful lover of right
Brother, mournful, wise, signed heir of bliss, faithful friend, ever faithful found, draws water for Ráma
Moonbright dame, weeping lady dear, Janak's bride, Dasharatha's son's bride, pale worn with dwelling in wild, Maithil dame, faithful
Brother, tamer of foe, duteous mind, steadfast, for truth renowned, chief of men, good Bharat, noble, suppliant, best of men
Brave brother, renowned for wise plans, shall attend on Bharat
King, father, lord of kings, died, enrolled with Gods on high, high-souled, ruled earth from sea to sea, purest king, aged, died rich in holy fame
Queen, Bharat's mother, made content, committed sin, woman's spite, wed by king, care saved king's life on Gods' and demons' fray
Queen mother, faded cheek, weeping eyes, royal widow, long-eyed lady, mournful, embraced Sítá
Queen, royal widow, soothed Kausalyá
Saint, household priest, soul athirst to look on Ráma, placed royal widows in line, blessed with holy verses
Virtuous chief of twice-born sages, replied in words that virtue's law defied
Noble mind, gentle, modest, meek, kind, follower of princely youth, constant truth, lent arm to guide Ráma
Ladies placed in line by Vasishtha, moving faint and slow, mournful queens
Nobles, each counselor and peer sat humbly behind, pressed around, priests and lords of state
People, youthful captains, crowd whose cheeks were wet, multitude with longing moved
Person loaded with curses deep and loud by crowd
Great saint of high renown near holy town, recited text about son freeing sire
Royal town, widowed state reft of king disconsolate, fair town, city to dwell, realm
Holy side, lovely stream ever blossomed crowned, fair descent, pure pellucid shallow, shore, bank's descent
Door gained, sacrificial ground, where hero met ladies' eyes, dwelling
Pleasant side, lovely lawns, rolled echoing sound like roar of lions
Mighty wilderness, wild forest, lonely wood, silvan world, wild domain, woods for devotee
Holy town in Behar where funeral offerings made, every good Hindu ought make offerings to ancestors
Region of hell, infernal pains, to which men doomed who leave no son for funeral rites
For which Yamuná yearns, king ruled earth from sea to sea, boundless main
River that yearns for Ocean, impetuous waters flee
Due offerings to parting shade, sacred water to spirits, drops duly shed, tribute to father's shade, offering which shall aye endure
Pressed fruit, fresh bark mantle, seed mixed with jujube, cake offered on sacred grass, points laid directed to southern sky, humble gift
Children precede by age, then women, then men youngest first eldest last, reversed descending into water
All gathered heaps must waste, death is end of life, all joined apart must fall, ripened fruit must fall, inevitable death, life flies as torrents
Night flies no more returns, days nights pass swiftly, death travels with us, lives decay as seasons smile, drifting logs meet and part
Yield government to Ráma, return to realm, roars of elephants, women rejoice, consecration paramount, four castes justest care
Householder order best of four orders: student, householder, anchorite, mendicant, three debts: to Gods men Manes
King wed Kaikeyí swore best kingdoms, on Gods' and demons' fray gave future boon, promise brought to mind, boons given, word inviolate
Puttra from Put and tra deliverer, son born to free sire from infernal pains, funeral rites at Gayá, release from pains of hell
Words that virtue's law defied, weak and vain thought, ties of kindred mean nothing, alone babe opens eyes alone dies
Bharat told king is gone, enrolled with Gods on high, mournful news, Sítá knew king's fate, sharp pangs smote
Ráma asked Lakshmana bring Ingudí fruit and bark mantle, Sítá go first, then thou, then I last
Sumantra and brothers guided Ráma to holy side, heroes found lovely stream, bent in bitter sorrow
Where stream showed pure shallow, duly shed drops, said 'Father this be thine', Ráma turned to southern side stretched arm weeping
Ráma offered fresh tribute with brothers' aid, jujube mixed with Ingudí seed on sacred grass, weeping said enjoy cake
Ráma retraced path up mountain's pleasant side, gained cottage door, strained brothers and Sítá to breast, cry of weeping rose
Army shook with fear hearing weeping, left car and wain, ran toward weeping, earth sent deafening noise, elephants fled in fear
Chief found on sacrificial ground, crowd loaded curses on hump-back and queen, ran in fond affection, looked on multitude
Vasishtha placed royal widows in line, ladies saw stream, saw bank's descent, saw funeral offering, came to hermitage
Hero met their eyes like God fallen from skies, clasped lotus feet, brushed dust, Lakshmana paid reverence, Sítá bent before widows
Ráma pressed saint's feet with reverential love, took seat near him as Indra clasps Heavenly Teacher's feet
Bharat with counselors, peers, citizens, captains sat humbly behind, nobles pressed round, like three fires with holy priests
Mother made content, government given to Bharat, now yield to thee, people long to see lord restored, roars of elephants
Ráma consoled lamenting prince: mortal still, fate's slave, death inevitable, grief for father useless, virtue wins bliss, keep father's decree
Good Bharat replied: pardon mother's sin, dismiss trespass, preserve us all, consecration paramount, take royal might, I pray with head bent low
Ráma inexorable still, would keep sire's decree, firmness moved people, bent heads then weeping, queens filled with joy as Bharat prayed
Ráma replied: father swore kingdoms to Kaikeyí, gave boons, bade me to forest, I keep father's word, thou maintain word inviolate
Bharat lord of men reign over Ayodhyá, Ráma king of wild domain, white umbrella over Bharat, Ráma to shadow of bough
Virtuous Jáváli chief of sages replied in words that defied virtue's law: ties of kindred mean nothing, alone babe opens eyes alone dies

attributes.context: Bharat told mournful news that king gone, enrolled with Gods on high
Ráma spoke to moonbright dame: king is gone, Lakshmana thy sire is dead
Soon as she knew king's fate sharp pangs smote, could not look on lord, torrents poured
Ráma asked Lakshmana bring Ingudí fruit and bark mantle, pay offering due
Lakshmana addressed to bring fruit for offering
Noble mind follower with brothers' aid soothed grief, lent arm to guide lord to holy side
Hero found lovely stream, bent footsteps in bitter sorrow down fair descent
Brother participated in descent with Ráma
Prince came to river shore, holy side, lovely stream ever blossomed
Where stream showed pure shallow, duly shed drops, filled hollowed hand, turned to southern side stretched arm weeping
Offered fresh tribute with brothers' aid, mixed jujube with Ingudí seed on sacred grass, weeping said enjoy cake
Brother aided in offering fresh tribute to father's shade
Prince paid due offerings to parting shade, sacred water to spirits, offering shall aye endure
King lord of kings received offering, tribute to shade, blessed Gods ne'er refuse to eat food children use
Ráma retraced path up mountain, gained cottage door, strained brothers and Sítá to breast
Lady strained to Ráma's breast, cry of weeping rose loud as roar of lions
Brother strained to Ráma's breast, weeping echoed round mountain
Hero's cottage door, sacrificial ground, dwelling
Bharat's army shook with fear hearing weeping, soldiers cried 'Bharat his brother meets again'
Every man left car and wain, ran toward weeping, youthful captains sped to meet lord
Sinless glorious chief found on sacrificial ground, looked on multitude, threw arms about loved ones
Crowd loaded curses on hump-back and queen, cheeks wet eyes dim, ran in fond affection
Person loaded with curses deep and loud by weeping crowd
Saint soul athirst to look on Ráma, placed royal widows in line, traced way behind them
Ladies moving faint and slow saw stream, saw bank's descent, saw funeral offering
Queen with faded cheek weeping eyes spoke mournful tones to Sumitrá and rest
Hero left seat, clasped ladies' lotus feet, they brushed dust from shoulders
Brother drew near royal ladies, paid gentle reverence, received love and tenderness
Lady bent before widows, pressed feet with tears, they embraced her as darling child
Ráma pressed saint's feet with reverential love, took seat near as Indra clasps Heavenly Teacher's feet
Bharat with duteous mind, counselors, peers, citizens, captains sat humbly behind
Each counselor and peer, nobles pressed round hero
Bharat addressed chief: mother made content, government given, yield to thee, people long to see lord
Ráma heard words people approved, pressed by crowd with same request
Steadfast Ráma consoled lamenting prince: mortal still, fate's slave, death inevitable, father won skies
Prince with mournful mood, each ambitious thought controlled, heard steadfast Ráma's words
Good Bharat replied with varied lore: pardon mother's sin, dismiss trespass, I pray with head bent low
Ráma heard Bharat strive to bend will with suppliant head
Earth's lord inexorable still, would keep sire's decree, firmness moved people
Bharat strove to bend will, but steadfast chief kept promise, people wept and approved
Ráma far renowned replied: father swore kingdoms, gave boons, bade me to forest, I keep word
Ráma said: Bharat lord of men reign Ayodhyá, I king of wild domain, thee to umbrella, me to shadow of bough
Bharat urged to take royal might, white umbrella over brow, Shatrughna attend
Virtuous chief of twice-born sages replied in words that virtue's law defied
Ráma heard Jáváli after soothing brother's grief
Ráma son of king, offered tribute to father's shade, keep father's word, father swore kingdoms
Lakshmana knows thy sire is dead, participated in funeral rites
Bharat son of king, told mournful news, father died rich in holy fame, dare not blame aged king
Ráma's moonbright dame, dear consort, faithful wife who follows
Ráma's brother, faithful friend, ever faithful found, mournful, wise
Ráma's dear brother, duteous, noble, steadfast, tamer of foe
Bharat's mother who committed sin, made content, wed by king, saved king's life
Kausalyá's son, queen mother, clasped her lotus feet
Ráma taught: all must waste, death inevitable, ripened fruit falls, life flies as torrents
Ráma said: night flies no returns, death travels with us, lives decay, drifting logs meet and part
Bharat urged: yield government, return to realm, consecration paramount, householder order best
Ráma keeps father's word: king swore kingdoms, gave boons, promise brought to mind, word inviolate
Bharat urged: son born to free sire, Puttra from Put deliverer, funeral rites at Gayá release from pains
Jáváli spoke words defying virtue's law: ties of kindred nothing, alone babe opens eyes alone dies
King enrolled with Gods on high, devout famed, with Gods rolled, gained godlike bliss
Ráma compared to Indra's peer, took seat as Indra clasps Heavenly Teacher's feet
Indra in realms above clasps Heavenly Teacher's feet
King gained blissful home in Brahmá's heavenly home for aye
Ráma back to home go no more, widowed state reft of king, if to town I go
Bharat urged to speed to town, reign over fair town, lord of men
Ráma to DaG ak wood will stray, king of wild domain, silvan world
King's son to free sire from Put's infernal pains through funeral rites
